originalText: medicalVisions
Start Element
vision
::You leave the morgue, shaken up by fleeting memories, as though you've woken up in the middle of a dream and trying to grasp at its fading contents...::
::You feel pressure mounting inside your skull...::

::Pain debilitates you without warning. You feel it reverberating deep inside your abdomen, as though your intestines have become home to a mass of excruciated worms. 

The pain is growing, yet you are falling apart...::
::You hear words...::
::You feel a strong surge moving through your body...::
context.loc_xpbl_mc_resolved

::The first few steps you remember vividly, for each was marked with a pulse of immense, piercing headache. It was not the horror you were seeing, it was not the stench you were inhaling, neither the sinister reverberations nor the acidic taste you had in your mouth. 

It was *all* of this condensed into emotion that seeped through your skull and rooted itself into your mind. But with pure determination you kept your sanity and focus on reality and your goal.::

::Entering the morgue felt like returning to an imagined childhood home one couldn't wait to leave. The horror before your eyes was like those repressed, demented relatives; the morgue's stench much akin to the moldy storeroom everyone used; the sinister reverberations - scheduled train passes overhead, and the acidic taste in your mouth - unpalatable batch cooking.

It is this familiarity that prevented the invasive senses from overwhelming you and distracting you from reality and your goal.::

::You blink to reveal a new addition to your reality: Before you stands a young woman, a doctor wearing a white lab coat. Her entire body, hair, face, clothes - name tag as well - everything is smeared with green viscous blood. It is oozing out of her wounds and toward the floor, never reaching it but merely fading to oblivion. Her expression - a plea for salvation, if not through action then through observation...::
context.loc_xpbl_mc_visionsStarted

::You hear them in your mind. They are being spoken by a voice that is not yours - the Other Voice. The words may sound articulate and meaningful, they may be carried by a tone that is rich and pleasing, but they are not your words and it is not your voice the one uttering them.::

::It starts at the front of your brain and radiates away, passing through every organ and reaching every tissue and every cell, even if they are located in the remotest ends of your being. You open your eyes even though you are certain that they had already been opened, and you see veins, oddly-blue veins with membranes stretched thinly between them; through this layer of flesh you see light...::

Kill... me...

::The voice is whispering, yet its plea is deafening.::

::The mass of flesh shifting and moving and trembling before you was seemingly alive, begging not to be. Its hollow voice came from within your head, rambling about its troubled existence, every bit permeated with a desire for death. True death.

And this death you granted.::
BodyHorror
::[Will] Close your eyes.::
::Let her have your eyes.::
::Let the pain tear you apart.::

::So you address it, subconsciously, but the Other Voice doesn't stop or even pause. It carries on as though you were silent. You don't wish to stop or pause either. This is your mind, your refuge - your realm. 

Interloping vocals must be confronted.::
::Awake to your new existence...::

K-kill... me...

::Torturous vision...::

::The method you do not remember, but the more you stare at your blood-drenched self the more fragmented memories of this being's gory death start flashing before your eyes: gushing blood, ripping flesh, oozing slime and everything else.

After all of this you found yourself outside with a clear mind, a passing headache - and utter desensitization to body horror.::

::Her gaze is trying to pry your eyes open and pour terror into your heart through your optic nerves, but you manage to shut the lids of your sanity in time. Terrible things are unfolding before you - you feel them but cannot observe them. All you perceive is green light shining through your eyelids, and those you maintain firmly shut throughout the whole ordeal.::
::But you can't, and you are forced to stare...::

::The world darkens, the woman is glowing - and dissolving. Her once-lovely plump face, now bathed in green radiance, is degenerating into a visage of ineffable torment. She is frantically trying to hold it in place with her formless, useless hands.::

::With clenched teeth and in your own desperate embrace, you try to endure the mounting suffering. Pain must be ignored, the body must remain whole. This you repeat and repeat to yourself, not with spoken or imagined words - with language itself - but with pure willpower.

It comes from the mind, therefore the mind must be subdued...::
::You see or hear nothing that could be the cause of this maddening pain; you stare at your body but you are visibly whole, yet you are losing yourself one piece at a time.::

::But before you are able to even finish that thought you come to the realization that the dialog you've just engaged in is actually... beautiful. It is a contrapuntal dance of sentience - a captivating, profound and fluent interchange in which the two independent and adventurous melodic voices - Your Voice and the Other Voice - caress each other and give birth to mesmerizing harmony. 

Beauty of sound.::

::You close your eyes and fall to sleep. Nightmarish sensations loom out of the dark, passing through the event horizon you are attempting to conceive; strange sensations are trying to drag you back into the reality whence they come. You can see, smell, taste, hear, feel - but you'd rather not know what. You merely allow yourself to plummet until void is all there is, and in the void nothing can disturb you.::
::But the overwhelming senses won't let you...::

::You surrender to the senses. You can smell again - that scent that is redolent of death; you can hear again - that pulse of a sombre heart; you can taste again - that vile acidity. You try to move, struggle with all your might, but you are unable to - not until one of your arms victoriously rises in the air; you feel it and see its shadow through the fine tissue. ::

Kill... m-me...

::Agony...::
::Shake your head.::

::Slowly, the green light reverts to darkness and your heart stops racing. You open your eyes - the woman is gone. It is as though she was never there. The pressure in your head is gone too, and you feel like you're in control again.::

::Her gleaming hair is stretching into streams of odious slime and abandoning her scalp, while her charmingly green eyes are becoming repulsively greener, more swollen and less human. She cries and cries, caustic tears rolling down her departing cheeks, but her cries are silent. Silent, thankfully, for even if void of sound her misery is great enough to clot your very own blood.::
context.loc_xpbl_mc_visionCounter

::You aren't certain as to how much time has passed, but time *has* passed. Once you finally come to your senses it feels like the pain had stopped long ago. You are sitting on the floor, alive and whole, and most importantly - in complete control.::

::Your arms feel as though they are bare of flesh, that they are merely exposed bones being sanded down to the marrow by nothing more than passing air, bones that would scream had they voices with which to do so. Your skin, or what is left of it, is peeling away in strips, one after the other, coming closer and closer to releasing your vermicular innards all over the floor; and your face - has almost kissed it.::
::You like this. You can't not. And as soon as you sink into the enjoyment that sprang into your mind like an unexpected epiphany, the Other Voice's timbre changes...::

::It is time to wake up. Your senses return to life and tear down the void you've encased yourself in, returning you to reality. Nightmarish it is not, for the nightmare has passed without being able to carry you away with it.::

::You reach for this fleshy mass impeding your vision and grasp it like a cobweb, pulling it aside so that your eyes may fully bathe in light. It blinds you temporarily but you adore it nonetheless. Your vision is now clear, and you feel motion everywhere - you feel as though you're floating in a sea of corporeal waves. You must see it, so you slowly turn your eyes and gaze at it...::

Kill... kill... m-me...

::Subhuman dissonance...::
::Blink.::

::Slowly, the horrid scene fades away, much like her oozing blood did, but not to oblivion and certainly not before scarring your eyes. 

The pressure in your head is gone.::
::Stand up.::

::As the suffering consumes the last bits of your sanity, you collapse - capitulate to this inexplicable decay of your body. You are now a repugnant, morbid pile of writhing guts, a stomach-churning sludge of your former self, a collocation of disintegration. The pain does not cease, even though your nerves feel no more. You see but the distant ceiling... but then your eyes begin to dissolve; something is eating away at the edges of your vision until it becomes narrower and narrower, contracting toward the center... until darkness consumes your whole existence.::
::Keep speaking and keep listening...::
::Move.::

::...and faint. 

You open your eyes even though you are sure they had already-- 

No, you remember it now: You fainted. You remember... horror. Utter horror. But you must look again no matter what. As you lay those fearful eyes upon yourself again, the shock surges through you like the energy that woke you from your timeless slumber; the feeling shakes you not unlike a bowl of living jelly... from which you, in fact, might not be so different.::

Kill... 

::Awakening of death...::

::Then you take a deep breath and feel your body again. You're lying on the floor but you are alive and whole. 

The pain is gone, but the memory of it writhes inside you still.::

::It is time for the Other Voice to leave. You begin zoning the voice out, even though it is shouting for its existence. You hope to overpower it with your own voice, but something is wrong - it doesn't sound like your voice anymore. It is similar... but different.::
::The more you try to overpower its voice, the louder it becomes. And the more you try to control your own voice, the more you realize you cannot.::

::The Other Voice drops in pitch, becoming coarse and foul. Its previously impeccable rhythm is now but vulgar syncopation clashing with your fluent lines, turning euphony into nightmarish cacophony as the hostile notes claw at each other in dissonance. A speedy decomposition of this colloquy is taking place and there is nothing you are able to do to rectify it.::

::You look... abnormal, malformed, oddly-blue and disgustingly-red; and tumorously green. You are unable to recognize most of you, or at least what you think is you. Everything is moving, voluntarily and not, but you are alone. 

You are alone. So much motion yet it's all a single soul. You are alone. And you will stay alone.::

me...

::...feel closer than ever.::

::Fearing what you might hear should you continue, you focus... focus on what your voice should - *must* sound like before you dare using it again. You remember the conversations you have had during your life, as many as you can, collecting the information you'd need to confidently establish your rule over your mind with the *correct* voice. These waves coming from the past are drowning out the Other Voice until it sinks into nothingness. 

All that is left for you is to speak...::

::Then, without missing a single grim beat, the words lose all of their meaning: You cannot differentiate one word from another, and all you can understand, if barely, is something you'd rather never hear again. Now, slurred and incomprehensible, the Other Voice rings with mounting subhumanity.::
...please.

::And so you do. Your voice is no longer just your imagination - you can hear it. You hear other sounds as well - but no Other Voice. 

Your surroundings become real once again.::

::Its corruption is contagious, because you comprehend in horror that your voice has turned into hollow, despondent hollering as well; dread grows inside you as you realize that you are forgetting the melodious beauty of the human voice... and what those words you had spoken so delightfully meant. Your thoughts are slowing down, and the two voices merge into monophony. Droning monophony.::
::Take a deep breath.::

::You can now only vaguely remember random disjointed syllables you had once been uttering, devoid of most of their meaning and purpose. But you don't even care anymore. Who could miss something so distant and vague? The sounds you are making now are just an extension of your breathing, its mere idiosyncratic embellishments...

...concealing suppressed cries of pain.::

::And then you hear your own rapid breath, clear and unweighted. You speak them - words, just random words, only to hear what they sounds like. The melody is there - but the timbre of your voice has lost some of its overtones, lost some of its life.::
